data.title: Where to Stay near Vancouver Cruise Port Canada Place?
data.meta_description: Where Should I Stay near Vancouver Cruise Port? Book best hotels close to Canada Place cruise ship terminal (walking distance).
data.text:
Posted by Stefan DP – Last Updated on December 29, 2023

Vancouver is an incredibly popular destination with many tourists enjoying an Inside Passage cruise along British Columbia’s rugged, unspoilt coastline.

While waiting to embark, there’s accommodation to suit every budget including the luxury hotels near the busy cruise ship terminal at Canada Place.

Where to Stay?

Several downtown hotels are within easy walking distance from Vancouver cruise port. The closest one is the Pan Pacific hotel.

Good value hotels are available in West End which has easy access to both the wild forests of Stanley Park and Robson Street that’s packed with sophisticated stores and restaurants.

Yaletown is famous for its vibrant nightlife while hotels near to the airport offer more tranquil surroundings. The historic area of the city is Gastown.

Most downtown hotels are well located for sightseeing, shopping, and dining. No matter where you book a hotel in the downtown area you will have restaurants within easy walking distance.

The most conventient hotels near Vancouver cruise port are those within walking distance, but most of these properties are not cheap. When looking for a more affordable hotel close to Canada Place, check the Days Inn by Wyndham.

There are no difficult slopes to negotiate as you follow the sidewalks, making the short walk of just a few minutes particularly easy if you have wheeled luggage. Even if you stay a bit further out, a walk of twenty to thirty minutes can be manageable but can be uncomfortable with luggage.

If your hotel isn’t walkable from the pier, it’s good to know Vancouver downtown hotels are a short 5 to 10 taxi min ride from the cruise terminal. Fair rate will be $5 to $15 depending on traffic. You can also opt for a hassle-free private transfer.

Read also: Vancouver hotel deals

What are the Closest Hotels near Vancouver Cruise Port? (within walking distance)

1. Pan Pacific Vancouver Hotel ★★★★★ (Closest)

For easy access to the Canada Place cruise terminal, you can’t get any closer than this Downtown hotel. You simply descend in the elevator to the parkade level and follow the short pathway that leads directly to the port.

As one of the most luxurious hotels in the district, the Pan Pacific offers spacious suites and rooms that are elegantly styled. Plush carpets and drapes have individual color schemes of antique gold, green and warm brown creating a cozy, relaxing atmosphere. The panoramic views of the bay and port are truly magnificent.

Why Stay Here

Closest hotel from Vancouver cruise port

Rooms with harbor view

Shore to ship luggage transfer service

Cruise Expert Rating: 9/10

2. Fairmont Pacific Rim ★★★★★ (Top Hotel)

Located on the waterfront near Canada Place, this is one of the best hotels for enjoying a truly luxurious stay before joining your cruise liner. The glamorous, contemporary entrance hall has marble pillars and golden chandeliers while the sophisticated bars have an atmosphere of minimalist chic.

Every comfortable, elegant room is furnished in a sleek, modern style. Outside, you can stroll through a charming garden terrace. From the wall to wall windows or rooftop pool, you can admire the incredible views of the North Shore Mountains on the other side of the harbor.

Why Stay Here

4 min walking from cruise terminal

Rooms with port view

Rooftop pool

Cruise Expert Rating: 9/10

3. Fairmont Waterfront ★★★★★ (Luxury)

The contemporary exterior of the Waterfront hotel has become one of the most instantly recognizable landmarks of the city. Built in 1991, this glamorous hotel has cozy lounges and bars with sophisticated amber colored lights and gray seating.

In the spacious rooms, you’ll find a blend of modern and traditional design complete with comfortable armchairs and cozy drapes that create a lovely, welcoming atmosphere. Many rooms have glorious views of the coastline around Stanley Park. One of the hotel’s best kept secrets is its rooftop herb garden where bees busily produce honey every year.

Why Stay Here

Connected to Canada Place cruise ship terminal

Rooms with harbor view

Luxury Hotel

Cruise Expert Rating: 9/10

4. EXchange Hotel Vancouver ★★★★ (Popular)

This luxury Downtown hotel on Howe Street was originally built in 1929 as the home of the Stock Exchange. Its elegant, Art Deco exterior forms an historic part of Vancouver’s architectural heritage. There are also striking interior design features to admire, from ornate vaulted ceilings to the glamorous 1930s inspired entrance hall. Spacious, cozy lounges feature comfortable seating, deep pile carpets and golden candelabras.

The luxuriously decorated rooms include wallpapered walls in rich, warm patterns and mirrors beautifully edged in gold. The EXchange is a 4 minute walk from the cruise ship terminal.

Why Stay Here

Only 4 min walk from cruise port

Central location, close to everything

Heated bathroom floor

Cruise Expert Rating: 9/10

5. Auberge Vancouver Hotel ★★★★

Built in a prime Downtown location in 1998, the sophisticated Auberge Vancouver Hotel allows you to reach the Canada Place cruise port in just a few minutes. The impressive entrance hall presents a welcoming, minimalist appearance with warm illumination.

Each of the luxurious rooms has a beautifully elegant color scheme of cream and beige highlighted with soft furnishings in bright magenta. Comfortable seating and cozy bistro style tables and chairs heighten the chic image. There are fascinating city or harbor views, but at the nearby Vancouver Lookout, you’ll enjoy a 360 degree panorama.

Why Stay Here

Walking distance from cruise port (5 min)

Great location

Beautiful, comfortable rooms

Cruise Expert Rating: 9/10

6. Delta Hotels by Marriott Vancouver Downtown Suites ★★★★

A 6 minute walk from the Canada Place cruise terminal brings you to the Delta Hotel in downtown Vancouver that opened in 2009. The spacious lounge has a sophisticated color scheme of gray and silver with modern, russet seating. One of the stylish bars has glossy green tiling, pendant globe lamps and high bar stools with tubular metal frames.

Elegantly styled, minimalist rooms feature decor and furnishings in soothing neutral colors. It’s one of the best locations if you want to enjoy quality time relaxing in the local boutiques.

Why Stay Here

Canada Place is 6 min away on foot

Comfy and spacious rooms

Excellent central location

Cruise Expert Rating: 9/10

7. Hotel Le Soleil by Executive Hotels ★★★★★ (Great Value)

Tastefully, but lavishly decorated, this luxury hotel presents a captivating image of old world charm. The atmospheric entrance hall is beautifully decorated with Grecian pillars, intricate panelling and polished wooden staircases. Even the dark mahogany bell desk is embellished with carved scrollwork. There are cozy fireplaces and candelabras in the lounges filled with traditional upholstered furniture.

Beautiful paintings, lamps and ornaments can be found throughout the hotel. Elegant, wallpapered rooms are comfortably furnished. When it’s time to sail, it takes just seven minutes to walk to the Canada Place port.

Why Stay Here

Hotel within 7 min from Vancouver cruise port

Good value for money

In the heart of downtown

Cruise Expert Rating: 9/10

8. Days Inn by Wyndham Vancouver Downtown ★★★ (Affordable)

The Days Inn offers an affordable, but comfortable vacation in warm, cozy surroundings that blend modern and traditional design. Colorful artwork decorates the well-appointed dining room and lounges. Individual rooms are surprisingly spacious and furnished in a minimalist style with comfortable seating and elegant drapes.

By contrast, the bar with its extensive wood panelling, brass globe lamps and leather topped stools has a traditional 1930’s charm. It’s the best place to stay if you want to reach the cruise terminal in less than 10 minutes without exceeding your vacation budget.

Why Stay Here

Walking distance from cruise port

Affordable

Good central location in downtown Vancouver

Cruise Expert Rating: 7/10

Downtown Hotels often booked by cruisers

1. YWCA Hotel Vancouver ★★★

If you want to save money before or after a cruise vacation, the budget-friendly YWCA is a perfect choice. The hotel has a friendly, welcoming atmosphere and it’s decorated throughout in a bright, colorful fashion complete with contemporary artwork and furniture. Blue pastel walls and contrasting orange chairs are in the spacious entrance hall and lounge.

You’ll find the individual rooms are simply, but comfortably furnished in white with beige drapes. Located near to the Rogers Arena, the YWCA is ideal for entertainment and it’s less than 20 minutes walk or a short 5 min cab ride from Canada Place.

Why Stay Here

Budget friendly & best value hotel

Walking distance to most places

Comfortable rooms

Cruise Expert Rating: 8/10

2. Hotel BLU ★★★★ (Top)

The Hotel Blu is a great value for money property located between Downtown and Yaletown where it’s near to Granville Street’s nightlife and around twenty minutes from the Port of Vancouver. Inside the hotel, there’s a glamorous entrance hall with bright blue neon lights and a staircase of metal and glass.

Some of the stylish suites are split over two floors and include a private lounge with French windows leading to a small outdoor balcony. Throughout the modern, well-appointed rooms there is an elegant color scheme of pastel beige walls and drapes complemented by green, blue and cream upholstered furniture.

Why Stay Here

Five min taxi ride from Vancouver Cruise terminal

Indoor pool

Top reviewed

Cruise Expert Rating: 9/10

3. Blue Horizon Hotel ★★★★ (Very Popular)

This deluxe West End hotel is located on Robson Street, one of the most famous thoroughfares in Vancouver where you’ll find exclusive stores and restaurants. The spacious, elegant rooms are decorated with a selection of deep brown or beige tones. They include comfortable, upholstered furniture in complimentary colors of cream, gray and smoky blue.

Every room has elegant drapes, table lamps and paintings. You can enjoy fascinating city views, but if your room’s on a higher floor, you’ll also see Vancouver Harbour. A walk of twenty minutes leads to the cruise liner port.

Why Stay Here

Good location and value

Very popular top hotel

Rooms with balcony & water view

Cruise Expert Rating: 9/10

4. Times Square Suites Hotel ★★★ (with Kitchen)

King George VI opened this West End hotel in 1939. Its beautiful facade of decorative, warm red brick features bay windows and a small tower with two clocks. Many of the suites have French windows opening onto wrought iron Juliet balconies. Inside, the rooms are well-appointed in pastel colors with a featured wall around the cozy fireplace in either orange, moss green, magenta or purple.

Comfortable seating, paintings and lamps add to the friendly atmosphere. Nearby are the forests of Stanley Park and it takes around 5 minutes to reach the port terminal by Uber or taxi.

Why Stay Here

Aparthotel

Suites with fully equipped kitchens

Walking distance from Stanley Park and the harbor

Cruise Expert Rating: 9/10

5. Residence Inn by Marriott Vancouver Downtown ★★★ (Good Value)

Built in 1985, this multi-storey hotel is located to the south of Yaletown near the nightclubs of Granville Street. The lounges are in a bold, contemporary design with brightly patterned flooring and boxy, red and gray upholstered chairs.

You’ll find the individual suites combine gentler, neutral tones with occasional highlights of brown, russet or deep magenta in the soft furnishings. Many of the rooms have balconies with a small table and chairs where you can relax while admiring the amazing city views. Canada Place can be reached in 20 minutes on foot or 5 min by car.

Why Stay Here

Great location

Good value for money hotel

Indoor swimming pool

Cruise Expert Rating: 9/10

6. Rosedale on Robson Suite Hotel ★★★ (Popular)

Built in 1995, the twenty-one storey Rosedale on Robson has an impressive exterior featuring multiple bay windows. This great value hotel has a friendly atmosphere and offers comfortable, spacious suites where you can relax in style.

They include a blend of traditional and modern wooden furniture and upholstered sofas. The color scheme throughout features pastel, neutral tones with deep blue drapes and soft furnishings. Outside there is a quaint garden terrace and access to Yaletown, one of the trendiest areas of the city. It takes approx twenty minutes to walk to Canada Place cruise ship terminal and around 5 min by cab.

Why Stay Here

Great location

Well equipped suites

Smoke free hotel

Cruise Expert Rating: 8/10

What are the Best Hotels near Vancouver Airport?

Why Stay near the airport ?

If you’re visiting Vancouver for a few days while waiting to join your cruise ship, a hotel near the airport is convenient and often less expensive when compared to similar establishments in the city.

Most of the hotels in the immediate area operate a free shuttle to and from the airport, and several offer free breakfast as well. It’s approximately 16 kilometers or 10 miles to Canada Place, but there is an efficient Skytrain service at the airport that takes you to Vancouver Canada Place cruise port.

From the airport take the Canada Line route. There are 13 stations on this route, starting with YVR airport. Get off at the final station “Waterfront” and then it’s just a few minutes walk to the terminal. The rate is approx. $8.00 CDN per person. Taxi is about a half hour drive and will cost around $36.00 CDN each way. You can also easily book a private transfer.

1. Fairmont Vancouver Airport In-Terminal Hotel ★★★★★ (Luxury)

The Fairmont forms part of the Vancouver Airport Terminal and provides convenient, luxury accommodation in a semi-rural location. Throughout the rooms and lounges there are floor to ceiling windows where you can admire the most spectacular views of the nearby mountain range.

A glamorous interior boasts a sophisticated combination of contemporary and traditional styling with glass chandeliers, spotlights and warm wooden panelling. Elegant, comfortable rooms have pastel drapes and a variety of colorful carpets. Located close by is the Skytrain that connects to the Waterfront Station at the cruise terminal.

Why Stay Here

One of best hotels near Vancouver Airport

Walking distance from airport terminal

Luxury hotel

Cruise Expert Rating: 9/10

2. Radisson Hotel Vancouver Airport ★★★★

This 4 star hotel provides a convenient free shuttle service to the Vancouver Airport, which is on the other side of the Fraser River. The hotel lobby presents a sophisticated image with a curved bell desk, staircase and upper balcony.

Each room is elegantly styled with pastel walls, comfortable furniture and colorful accessories such as pictures, rugs and table lamps. Just two minutes away you’ll find the Skytrain that reaches the Canada Place cruise port in under thirty-five minutes.

Parking is available for a fee while staying at the hotel, and there is an option for leaving the vehicle after departure while enjoying your cruise vacation.

Why Stay Here

Free airport shuttle

Shopping and dining options within walking distance

Indoor pool

Cruise Expert Rating: 8/10

3. Coast Vancouver Airport Hotel ★★★

The hotel is located almost two miles to the northeast of the Vancouver Air Terminal and operates a convenient shuttle service to and from the airport. Inside, the spacious lounges and dining areas combine modern gray chairs with wooden panelling and russet walls to present a warm, cozy atmosphere.

One of the chic bars has a highly polished counter and metallic accessories while the comfortable rooms have an elegant, minimalist decor of white, brown and beige. The local Skytrain takes you to the shopping malls of nearby Richmond and to Vancouver cruise port.

Why Stay Here

Easy free shuttle service to and from the airport

Very popular hotel

Good value

Cruise Expert Rating: 7/10

Port of Vancouver

Canada Place Cruise Terminal – Downtown Vancouver

The main cruise port terminal at Canada Place was completed in 1985 and provides safe anchorage for some of the world’s most luxurious liners.

It’s located in the heart of downtown Vancouver bc, only 5 minutes’ walk away from Gastown. At least 800,000 tourists pass through the port every year.

Who Sails from Vancouver

Vancouver is a home port to numerous ships from lines including Princess Cruises, Holland America Line, Celebrity Cruises and Norwegian Cruise Line.
